content: The Taj Mahal, one of the seven wonders of the world, is located on the southern bank of which river?

The Taj Mahal, one of the seven wonders of the world, is located on the southern bank of the Yamuna River in Agra, India. This magnificent mausoleum was built by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his beloved wife, Mumtaz Mahal. The Yamuna River plays a significant role in the architecture and symbolism of the Taj Mahal, as it reflects the beauty of the monument in its serene waters.
